content.description: A conservative net force <math alttext="F sub x" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> is exerted on an object within a system. The force varies as a function of the position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> of the object, as shown in the graph. There are no net external forces exerted on the system.
content.question: Which of the following correctly describes the potential energy <math alttext="U sub system" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>sys</mi></msub></math> of the system as the object moves from <math alttext="0 meters" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> to <math alttext="0.10 meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="U sub system" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>sys</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> increases only.
<math alttext="U sub system" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>sys</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> decreases only.
<math alttext="U sub system" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>sys</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> decreases and then increases.
<math alttext="U sub system" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>sys</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> does not change.

content.answer: <math alttext="U sub system" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>sys</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> increases only.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
